name: Elizabeth Reddington
text: enjoyed my time. will be back for sure

name: bjnewman2222
text: I rented a pontoon boat for the afternoon this past Saturday.  Form my initial call to ask about availability to our successful rental and return of the boat, the experience was seamless.  They easily accommodated the last minute rental, were flexible when dealing with the challenges of the boat (radio), we're very timely with getting the boat in and out of the water and maintained a professional approach throughout.  There was some confusion about fuel charge that was completely my misunderstanding. No fault of theirs. Again, management handled it very well. Would surely recommend rentals from them.

text: Great spot for fuel, and ice, on Lake Tuscaloosa, just south of Tierce Patton farm Rd, off 43.

text: If they are as inconsiderate in business as they are in their driving habits I would pass by and not stop.

name: BAMA AUTO SERVICE
text: I’ve personally been doing business with Mr. Pierce and his family for a couple years and can honestly say they are some of if not the most honest and dependable people I’ve ever done business with in my life!! The Pierce’s have gone above and beyond to make sure our business deals have not only been fair but done in way that insures the customers satisfaction above their own!!! I’ve also had the privilege of seeing what they do with their time and money personally in giving back to the community and volunteering in ministry and other activities!! I encourage everyone to do business with them and I’ll go as far as to personally guarantee you’ll be treated fair and honest!!  I own a mechanic shop and have owned multiple businesses in my lifetime. I deal with several car lots and the Pierce’s are the finest people I’ve ever done business with!!!!!

name: Kristin Ayers
text: Love this place I just recently got my 3rd vehicle from them they are an amazing family. And will work with you as best as they can. I will never go anywhere else for my vehicle needs and it doesn't stop there they have boats fourwheelers tractors if you need anything just give them a call and they will help you out as much as possible.

name: Joe Goodman
text: Good quality vehicles and great prices.

name: Caleb Dickey
text: My wife and I both are very pleased with the service we received from Pierce Car and Truck Sales! Highly recommend them if you are searching for a vehicle! Already eyeing my next purchase to be a boat!

name: Doug Williams
text: I bought a Truck and a boat from pierce auto and have been very pleased with the honesty and service with this company and will buy again in the near future 💚 and the prices were fair too I highly recommend them to all my friends.

name: Montgomery Waylon
text: Brought a 2000 Camero from here on March the 1st which was a Friday. I brought the car back in on Monday the 4th and told them the service engine light came on and something under the car was rattling. I was told by the owners son that he didnt know anything about standard shift cars and they would not be responsible for anything wrong with it. Almost 3 weeks later the car starts running hot. When my husband got to me to check it out he opened up the radiator to find that it is full of J.B block seal he runs over 80 gallons of water through the radiator trying to clean it out to no avail. We replaced the thermostat that was so coroded with block seal it was rusted up. I called and left a message with Pierce auto sales telling them that the car was running hot and because someone was trying to cover up a cracked block or blown head gasket and there was so much block seal in the radiator and engine that I didn't know if the car was going to make it home and that I really needed someone to call me back because I had no way to get it home. I never recieved a call back.It cost me $60 to rent a car dolly to drag it home. Now the car came with an outside warranty but because "whoever" filled the motor up with block seal to hide a major problem until they could find an idiot "me" to take the car off of there hands the warranty will not cover the car. So now I have a blown up car sitting in my yard that I drove less then a month and repo men knocking on my door because they want there car back and still after all this time I have yet to recieve a call from anyone at Pierce Auto Sales.  I recieved more help and sympathy from the repo man in 10 minutes then I have from Pierce in 2 months. I paid $1500 down for a car that didn't even last until the first payment was due. I dont bash people or businesses but i have tried every other way to get them to talk to me. I just want my money back so I can get a car that runs and won't leave me on the side of the road less then a month after purchase.

name: Angie Lowery
text: I highly recommend Pierce Auto if you are looking to purchase an  automobile or boat.

name: Carter Rhodes
text: Great folks to do business with

name: Tim McCormick
text: Dishonest business practices; avoid this place.

name: James Smith
text: I'm buying my truck here

text:
(Translated by Google) thanks for the imfo

thanks for the imfo

name: Tommy Hull
text:
Excellent Dealer! Made the buying process very easy. Bennett and all the staff are very professional. All of my questions were answered. Service department is great, made sure I knew when and what I needed to have serviced. Bennett even gave me his personal cell phone number. I’ve never had anyone make me feel more comfortable. Great buying experience!
Thanks, Rambo Marine

name: Joshua Williams
text: Our family bought a new Harris Tritoon from Zach several months ago. He was very helpful and showed us several different boats and options in the 30 degree weather. We would definitely recommend Rambo Marine to anyone looking for a good deal and an easy experience. Zach has called to check in on us several times to make sure everything is going great with the boat too!

resp.text: Joshua, thank you for taking the time to leave us a 5-star review. Enjoy your Harris!

name: Andrew Ellis
text: Had a great pre-buy, buying, and post-buying experience from Bennett and the folks at Rambo. The post-buy experience being the most important. I’ve not had the same 5 Star experience with other dealers. Thanks Guys!

name: Dylan Worth
text: Had a problem with the 2020 Axis we bought and Grant went out of his way to make it right even though we were all the way in Missouri. If you go here make sure you ask for Grant! Dude did a great job.

resp.text: Dylan, thank you for taking the time to leave an awesome review. We are glad Grant was able to help you out. Enjoy your boat!

name: Robbie Howard
text: Zach and the guys at Rambo have got to be the best in the business.  We made the change to Cobalt and could not be happier.  If you want the best possible experience (before and after the sale) go to Rambo - Westover.

resp.text: Robbie, thank you for taking the time to leave us a 5-star review. Enjoy your Cobalt!

name: Randall Rysedorph
text: 2020 should have been the worst year of our lives. But, with the help of Rambo Marine and Grant Stinson...it became one of the best with our Barletta purchase. Big ticket purchases need the help of good and honest people. Our family found that at Rambo. I would also recommend getting the wife a couple tiny bottles of wine before looking at what boats cost. it works like a charm.

name: Ray Cearing
text: The entire experience buying our boat was great. Bennett listened to what we were looking for and helped find the perfect boat. The showroom was neat and clean. Jeff was very helpful through the finance portion and Kirt wrapped it up with the delivery and orientation with our new boat. We received top notch service from the first phone call to the the delivery and beyond. I look forward to working with Rambo for the foreseeable future for maintenance and any other marine needs.

name: mitchell bailey
text: Nick and the service staff went out of their way to take care of my situation.  Very honest and dependable people.  Would definitely recommend their service department!

name: Ashley McCarty
text: First off I have a Harris tritoon with a Mercury motor and have only had it two years it has had a leak in the toon and the motor jumps the boat will only go 9mph we have taken it to Rambo 3 times first time they had it for 3 and a half months it came back worse than when it left us they keep saying they have fixed it but haven’t I have also had it serviced with them every time worst company I have ever delt  with and I advise no one to use them with the poor service my family has gotten here it is summer and we cannot use our boat because they did not do their job and fix it in the off season

resp.text: Dear Ashley. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We’re sorry you had a bad experience. Please feel free to reach out to our manager Bennett Rambo at 205-678-4321 with any further comments, or concerns. We would love to make things right if you give us another chance.

name: Lindsey Hull
text: Rambo Marine has the best costumer service around.

name: Greg Varner
text: I guess if you are not looking at a 150k boat they don't return calls or emails.

name: Donald LaVair
text: Staff was Great. Nice Barletta Pontoon boats.

name: John McGee
text: They must sell too many boats. Spent 30 min. standing and walking around show room, no one every ask if they could help. Several salespeople standing around, not a single one looked interested. We will buy form Airport Marine

name: Jason Arrington
text: Grant and Zack did a great job.   Love my new Axis A24

name: Michael Bradford
text: Best burgers around on US-280

name: Olin Barnes
text: Great service and excellent group of people to work with for your boating needs / very happy with Rambo

name: Anthony Migliaccio
text: Best boat buying experience I have ever had. Jerald Connolly my sales person was amazing and always responsive when I called. Wesley Ables was very help with the finalizing of the paper work and helped us obtain insurance.  Steven was the guy that delivered the boat to us. He was amazing also. He took us out on the boat, showed us how to operate all of the functions of the boat. This made it possible to start surfing that day.  What a time saver. I can’t say enough about how easy Rambo made the whole experience.  Thanks Rambo! We will do business again.

name: Jeremy DiPiazza
text: I have bought two brand new boats with Rambo in Westover on 2 separate occasions over the last 5 years. Very good experience. I felt like i was treated fair, paid a fair price, they were transparent, and very helpful. They have a very good inventory, and Zach Baucom was great to us. He helped us locate the boat we wanted. He delivered the new Malibu we recently purchased right to our dock, taught us how to operate all the complicated wake settings, even paired our iPhone to it, and answered our calls later in the season as we had questions during break-in. Very strong group of guys and girls over there. Highly recommend them.

name: David M
text:
Great experience with Lynn in Sales. Made the purchase easy and overcame a few obstacles for me. Kurt made a trip out to the lake to deliver the new boat. Great full explanation of how everything works. Even helped me fit into my boat house to make sure it was perfect, BEFORE I even bought the boat.
First class, Thanks guys

name: Jordan
text: I have bought 2 boats from Rambo and honestly I don't plan to buy anywhere else going forward. Customer service is great , selection is state of the art , sales force is on top of it  . Zach Baucom is super knowledgable and always available to help and answer questions , he even has been available on his off days . Zach has made both purchases very easy by going the extra mile todo things like meet me and my wife with paperwork when we couldn't escape our busy lives .  Thanks Rambo Marine ! I recommend everyone to do business with you guys .

name: Keith White
text: Can't say enough good things about the crew at Rambo Marine. I was in the market for a used Cobalt, and Bennett worked with me to find the right boat. He was very helpful and patient through the whole process. The search was smooth and enjoyable. Kirt drove over two hours to deliver the boat, and did an awesome job covering all of the features and operation of the boat. Couldn't be more happy with the boat. I know several others who have purchased from Rambo, and they have an excellent reputation for customer service. Highly recommend them to anyone in the market for a quality boat.

name: Walter Brush
text: Excellent customer service! Have done what they said cheerfully. So far we have received very kind & professional attention. I believe this is an excellent dealership.

name: Elana Weems
text: We had a great experience purchasing our boat and the follow-up service has been outstanding.  The staff (Lynn, Kirt, Grant and Nick) are all very knowledgeable, professional and squarely focused on customer service.   I highly recommend Rambo for any an all of your boating needs.

name: Raul Barboza
text: Great customer service

name: Shane P
text: Shout out to Grant at Rambo Marine for getting me into the Malibu family. The Malibu 23LSV is everything you could ever want in a surf or wakeboard boat. Their service department got get tuned up, inspected, and turned around in no time, and their crew got her shining like new and ready for the lake. Great pricing, dependable service, knowledgeable sales people, and easy access to any factory or upgraded parts through their parts department. If you haven’t been to Rambo Marine, you’re missing out.

name: Amy Stinson
text: Rambo Marine has been caring for our boat for years. We have enjoyed exceptional customer service. Their staff is always professional and willing to help.

name: William Blackwell
text:
I bought a Beautiful used 1994 Mastercraft ProStar 190 from Rambo Marine in July of 2015 and they put a new battery, new alternator, new starter and tune up to make sure my boat was in tip top running order before I took delivery. I could not be more pleased with my boat, its performance and the service after the sale from Rambo Marine!!! I ski at least twice a week during the summer so its very important that my boat performs as a World Record Ski Boat should.
I depend on Rambo Marine for the routine maintenance on my boat and I highly recommend them to anyone considering buying a boat or getting yours serviced. They truly are The Boat Professionals!!!
Thank You!!!

name: Don Gonzalez
text: After filing my previous review, Rambo Marine contacted me to say that they did send the replacement to Trident Marina.  I spoke to Trident and they had it for a few weeks but are very busy and never called me.  So everything is ok and I am pleased with my pontoon boat and service.  I should have called Trident earlier instead os waiting for them to call me.

name: William Viverette
text:
The name Rambo says it all. And the word Marine.

I had a hoot just walking up on some of the pontoons and tritoons. It's like being on a spaceship, that just happens to float.

name: Lynn Collins
text: Customer service is second to none with these guys!

name: Randall Deal
text: Outstanding customer service and sales staff.  High recommended!

name: Zane Schwenk
text: Great guys to deal with on a new MasterCraft, they have an AWESOME service department and really treat the customers like family.

name: Jonas Barrestam
text: Awesome service and great people to deal with. Don't live nearby but will still buy my stuff from them because I know they will get me what I need.

name: Chris Hatch
text: Home town service and expertise of marine craft

name: Kelle Pierce
text: The staff at Rambo Marine is excellent!

name: Retired & Roaming
text: Friendly and willing to help

name: ray lambert
text: Great people and great service

name: Frank Jones
text: I've taken my boat to Leon for years. He's one of the most honest and dependable guy you'll ever meet. Great prices too.

name: Scott Barnett
text:
Good honest people....
Very knowledgeable of boats and boat motor service...!!!

name: Drew Thornton
text: Leon is a top notch guy. Really knows his stuff and tells you if it is worth fixing or not

name: Billy Mitchell
text: Great prices good work takes a little time to get ur work done but he's a small shop he is honest and up front I will be back if I have to

name: Justin Pace
text: Would like to properly review their work but after a month my boat still isn't fixed...I will not go back

name: Stephanie Andrews
text: Great service, great price on fixing my boat, no complaints what so ever. Even after we payed, he explained/showed what he done to fix the problem

name: Jason Doedoe
text: Great service great knowledgeable owner and mechanic. Always up front and honest. Will continue to use their services.

name: Philip Johnson
text: Ricky is is the best.  The work is done fast and complete.  Also,  let you know if there are other things that might be a problem down the road.

name: John Beebe
text: They have product. They have knowledgeable sales, service and parts people. They are there to help you when you need help.

name: Adam Jennings
text: Took a long time to repair, boat still doesn't run good

name: Rodney Jennings
text: Worst experience ever!  The owner talks down to you and the hourly rate for service is unbelievable. They charged over $300 just to service my pontoon. They would do more business here if they had a better attitude. Will not go back.

resp.text: You were told you needed to wear a mask to come in for service per the owner. There is a sign in the door and a statewide mandate. As for the service on your pontoon. You had almost $130 worth of lubes and filters. You were charged for the disposal of said lubes and bill 1.5hrs @$110hr which is the median shop rate in this industry. We are a dealership not a shop with factory certified technicians and a master tech. While we appreciate your concern about how much business we generate, we feel we have done well being in business nearly 34 years now. If general service on your boat is too expensive for you to handle, I suggest you find another hobby.

name: Chris Bowles
text: Horrible service!!! Told me they didn't have time to give me an estimate on a repair, said come back some other time.  A friend went 2 weeks prior picked out a boat and got approved from bank.  Didn't get off work in time to sign papers.  They wouldn't meet him on Saturday to sign papers and pick up boat.  I highly recommend take your business else where.... like the boat gallery in Columbus ms

resp.text: You called during lunch time and was told the service manager was gone for lunch and to call back. Sorry that was inconvenient for you. As for your friend, if he was approved on a boat and put a deposit on one, someone would have been there to deliver a boat. We open on alternating Saturdays so we can spend time with our families.

name: Jon Small#
text: Great shop, very knowledgeable and great rates.

name: memory of crystal
text: Best experience ever thanks for great service

name: Jerome O'Bryant
text: Friendly and helpful service

resp.text: Thank you. We value your patronage

name: rex lewis
text: Clean friendly folks. Only down side 12 weeks to get a boat.  Which have no control out of.

name: rusty shacklford
text: Super helpful staff, usually have what I need in stock. Service department is top notch.

name: Mandolina Newman
text: Great folks to deal with.

name: Anna Claire Knight
text: Brad and Kathy were absolutely amazing in our boat purchasing process. They were extremely patient as we experienced a death in the family right when we were looking to go pick up the boat. Although we had never met either of them, they reached out multiple times only to see how we were doing and making sure we were okay. There’s nothing like feeling like people care when making a big purchase! Strongly recommend.

name: ashlee laughter
text: Justin, Brad & Kathy were AWESOME! We had a terrible experience at another location but let me tell you. The folks here at the Florence location REALLY were on their A game and took great care of my family & I. And we walked out happy proud new boat owners. Will definitely go back for anything else we may need along the way.

name: Ronald Thompson
text: This place is great

name: Brian Bastel
text: We were visiting from several hours away and they figured out a problem none of our mechanics from home could. It was the best customer service experience I’ve had in years. As a business owner that has built a business around customer service, I literally couldn’t have been more impressed with the experience and the entire staff!!!

name: gabriel hay
text: Top notch people. Absolutely no pressure to buy extra items. Very friendly.  We had a problem with our trailer lights connection.  3 people jumped right on it. It was a issue on the vehicle.  They fixed it quickly and didn't charge a dime. Great people.

name: Michael Brown
text: Service was good. One worker was there filling in from Lawrenceburg that was quite smart mouthed. Not much help and not very friendly.

name: Chad Hunter
text: Terrible customer service. We bought a new pontoon in May and we have 3.1 hours on it.  Our family has been stranded in a lightning storm with 4 small children.  This was the third time back to their service center for the same reason .  All the service employees have acted like we are stupid and we don't know how to drive a boat or put a gas cap on correctly. I would not reccomend anyone to this business.

name: Lance Clark
text: Lots of selection, and the sales staff was helpful but not pushy.  We were looking at the xp3 pontoon boats, and they had both new and used to choose from.

name: Mark Simpson
text: I have been dealing with Mike and his staff for years! They go out of their way to take care all your boating needs!

name: Bert Meharg
text: Wish I had know this place 6 boats,ago Great Service and Sales Prices un-beatable !!!

name: Sabrina Bryson
text: Very polite and helpful staff.   I would recommend them for all your boating needs.

name: Lynn Brewer
text: They are nice  people but the price you see is the price you pay.

name: Michael Francis
text: Nice Place, Good Guys! I'll be Back!

text: Has decent service department.

name: Myron Price
text: Bass buggy and good service !

name: TOmmy Elliott
text: If you need a boat or have questions ask Justin.

name: Nathan Clendenin
text: Great day on the Lake. We did a half day and got a 150hp pontoon boat and tube. Price is not cheap. We paid $350 for four hours plus paid to refill the gas. Worth it for some great family memories.

name: Regan Oliver
text: I do not recommend this company. They do not keep their word and the mechanics have no idea what they’re talking about. They told us they would honor their mistake then started giving us the run-around, next thing we know the owner refuses to talk to us personally regarding our agreement. Save your money, there’s no integrity within this company.

name: susan blythe
text: We rented a boat and a float and had a great time😊 Boat was great, and ready. Staff was great ❤️

name: Mark Day
text: We bought a boat from John at Boat Mart in May. He gave us a good deal on the boat and dry storage. It’s nice to have our boat stored and ready to use all at the same place we bought it.  The staff is very friendly. They made the purchase process super easy. I’ll be buying my next boat from Boat Mart!

name: James Ryan
text: Traded my older Yamaha 4 stroke 60 for a new Yamaha 4 stroke 115.  Great deal and very efficient service to change out. Would recommend Boat Mart. Thanks to John Jeremy and the entire staff for making my experience a good one.

name: Brad Wall
text: All boats were overpriced and no one seemed to be interested to talk with anyone

name: Kristie Silas
text: Heard about it bad company

name: Robyn Wilson
text: Customer service is extremely lacking here. First call to speak to a salesman, I am told "they are out on the dock", so I left my ph# expecting a call back-& no call back. I called back the next morning to get the same message & left my ph# yet again- no call back. Called back a third time later that same day & was told "they are busy". Not too eager to sell a boat here or take money! So, I told her I was tired of leaving messages & nobody returning my calls, I would hold until someone could come to the phone. Finally, John came to the phone & was not in the least bit helpful! We we're going to drive a hour to give him $$$ for a boat & he could have cared less! He didn't even have the consideration to let me know he had sold the boat we were asking about, good thing we didn't waste our time & drive a hour to find it was sold! I just happened to see it sold on marketplace. Thanks but NO thanks John!! Buyer beware unless you're not bothered by rudeness & indifference.

name: Julia Williams
text: John Barkley provided me with an excellent experience while buying my boat. No hassle was involved when it came to pricing. John was very helpful, informative, and courteous. The lady in the front office, Lisa, was efficient while providing me with my bill of sale. The office was very welcoming and clean. I couldn't have asked for a better buying experience.

name: Jason Wilcoxson
text: Everyone at boatmart is always friendly. Iv boat several boats from them and the process is always easy and quick

name: Beverly Williams
text: John is very motivated to find customers what they are looking for and always puts in the extra effort to make the experience exceptional. I appreciate that he is available around the clock with information to answer any questions. I would recommend Boat Mart to anyone, anywhere looking to buy or sell a boat - location is not a factor for John and the Boat Mart.

name: Keith Neal
text: Great experience with Boat Mart in Guntersville Alabama. Talking with them over the phone and until the day my boat was purchased was a great experience. Would highly recommend checking out Boat Mart . Their whole group was awesome to deal with. Ask for John B.  if you need a new boat.

name: William Graves
text: John and the staff was outstanding I would recommend them to anyone. Thank you all for the speed and easy financing. The quickest I’ve ever bought a boat thank. You and god bless

name: kara karnok
text: We took our daughter out for a day of swimming and tubing on a pontoon boat, and had one of the best experiences ever!!!  The customer service was great, the boat and equipment fit all of our needs and the scenery was Beautiful!  We mistakenly kept a light on the boat and ran our battery dead, and within 5 minutes help was there to get us up and running again.  Overall, great experience, and we will b back!!!!

name: Charles German
text: I bought a boat from John at the Boat Mart. Great experience. I drove out from Georgia to take a ride on one of the boats they had for sale. John had the boat ready and waiting for me. After a lengthy test ride (30 minutes) I was satisfied. John allowed me to watch his crew perform a compression test on the motor and checked all the fluids for me. The motor looked to be in great shape. His crew buffed and waxed the boat while we did the paperwork. The only thing we didn't test was the trolling motor batteries. Sadly I got home and realized they wouldn't charge. I called John and he apologized for the error and gladly paid for them to be replaced at my shop. Again, it was a great experience at the Boat Mart. Give them a call if you need a boat, they have a bunch to choose from.

name: John Flannagan
text: John was my main contact on a recent Bennington purchase and everything went smoothly. I will say that their price on the boat was more than fair and they gave me a great trade in value for my boat. Eric even brought the boat to me and took my boat home! Can't beat that deal. Thanks again.

name: John Carlton
text: Enjoyed my visit to the boat mart. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable during my new boat purchase process. Highly recommend using them. Ask for John if you are looking for a great deal on a boat!

name: Jacob Wolford
text: Excellent customer service. Have taken 3 boats there in the past years and have zero complaints. John goes out of his way to make sure that everything gets done right and Jamie is an excellent mechanic. Would highly recommend them to anyone.

name: Tammy Campbell
text: My husband and I recently purchased our Bennington Boat from Boat Mart. Thank you John Barkley and the staff for helping us to find the boat we were looking for! John was very helpful and quick to respond to any questions we had. Thanks again!

name: Brant Barnett
text: We recently bought a second used boat from John this year. He was great and went out of his way to accommodate our  needs . He was able to answer all our questions and made us a very reasonable deal. I would highly recommend John Barkley for your boating needs.

name: Krista
text: Check out Lakeside Boat Storage. They have great pricing on annual slips!

name: Mike Couch
text: Our new 2019 ride coming soon! John was very helpful with helping us customize our new pontoon boat! We having been shopping and comparing prices and John at Boat Mart beat them all!

name: Roi
text: If you're in the market for a pontoon boat look no further. Boat Mart is the only place to purchase a boat. I have priced Bennington boats over a 100 mile radius and John gave me the absolute best price I could find anywhere. I truly enjoyed my experience and would definitely go back to purchase another one. John had the boat ready before the projected date it was due to be ready. I forgot my trailer latch when picking up the boat and John was kind enough to give me one at no charge. John took the time to go over the boat to show us how everything worked. Lisa had all of our paperwork ready to go when we got there and we were in and out in less than 5 minutes. Lisa even took the time to fax the paperwork ahead of time so we could get the registration out of the way. Keep up the good work guys.

name: Pam Miller
text: Do not rent from Boat Mart bad experience there boats are not up to standards it doesn't matter if u have reservations they are not organized, rude ,the boat we had first had issues we had to return it for a much smaller boat my family of eight,  the  boat we got to drive "Didn't"  have a anchor on board ,radio was pulled out ,gas monitor didn't work !! I payed a total $444.37 for boat & gas !! Yes John I am still A Mad Granny!!😡

name: Paul Wascher
text: I called John about a boat he listed on Craigslist. (Grizzly Tracker). I drove 3hr away to meet him and when I got there he had the boat hooked up to the tractor and ready for a test drive. After a short test drive, I decided to buy the boat. It was a hassle free buy and John was very helpful and friendly. Would strongly suggest buying a boat from him. The boat I bought was missing a tail light from the trailer and a navigation light. John gave me both parts from the service shop for no extra charge. Great experience

name: Belinda Hill
text: Just purchased our pontoon boat from John. Great guy and very helpful with all our concerns and questions. Will definitely come back when we are ready to upgrade.

name: Gus Prouty
text: John, ms Lisa, and the gang at Boat Mart do a great job! Great transaction and very nice folks! They get my highest recommendation!

name: True southern Accent
text: Well to be honest. We just passed it going to Fire on the Lake. It is a beautiful marina.

name: Brian Dodson
text: Just bought my second boat from Boat Mart!  Great prices and service!  Picked it up today, and even though winter is here, we will still get out on the lake!

name: Justin Perry
text: Bought our jet-ski from John. Everyone was very helpful and had great service. 10/10 would recommend

name: Cristy Cowan
text: Super helpful lady!

name: Frances LaPlant
text: The customer service was horrible. Lady at the front desk was very rude. When we asked for dock lines and bumpers, because we were keeping it over night, she told us to ask someone else because she didn’t know anything about boats. The boat had no anchor or running lights. Which we found out after the fact. The Bimini top was broken. Everything on the boat was dirty or molded. If my husband didn’t know how to work on boats, we would have been stranded. When we returned the boat, my husband tried to talk to them about the boat so they didn’t rent it out to someone else before checking it out. The lady at the front desk was very rude again and said that she didn’t know about boats so she didn’t know why he was telling her and the mechanics didn’t work on Sundays. It was just very unnecessary. There was no apology or anything. They didn’t even care. We should have read these reviews before we rented!!!!!!! Horrible place to rent from. We have a boat at home and this place is just NOT up to par!!

name: Lance Curry
text: CAUTION...to those looking to work with this business...their customer service via phone, as well as the front desk is atrocious. Nothing but rude. We rented a boat, which broke down within 20 minutes of pulling out of their marina. I called to have a tow in, and the lady on the phone talked to me like I was a complete idiot, then passed the phone to another lady who was only slightly less rude. After calling back and finally securing a tow in, I was given an option of free gas. By the time the tow got there, and after a few more calls back and forth,  including more rudeness,  an extra hour of time on the boat was offered beyond our time to return....I asked for the gas, and the extra hour for the inconvenience...I was then told I could have one, or the other, but not both...I let the lady know we would discuss it once I got back to their marina...she then called back,  as I was being towed, and I was told I HAD to make a decision regarding one, or the other regarding free gas fill up, or an extra hour right then and there. I advised her that no ma'am, I would speak to her about the issue once I finally arrived back, and ended the call...upon return to their marina, some 30-40 minutes later after being dead in the water,  they sent out a teenager, or barely 20 year old young man to interact with me...he asked if I had my decision...I advised that we wanted the gas comped, and an extra hour, or we wanted our money back...he offered me half price on gas, and the extra hour...I advised him that his offer was unacceptable, and we would be needing our money back...he then agreed to the free gas and extra hour. The second boat had a couple of safety concerns, but ran fine. The boats horn (a legal requirement) did not function,  and the door closest to the motor was missing...a child could very easily fall into the water if not paying attention.....all this being said, the young men working at the dock were nothing but courteous and helpful...the gentlemen who towed me in, again, very polite and helpful...but the customer facing folks inside the main shop were some of the rudest and most poorly trained people working in a customer service industry I've ever dealt with. I appreciate the gentlemen who knew how to treat a customer, but because of the other employees,  me and my other group of 10 will not ever be bringing our business back, and I give WARNING to any other user interested in renting from this group.

name: Mark Moore
text: Paid these people nearly 1000$ for boat repairs  they told me 3 times it was ready and it won't run for @###% !!! . Can't believe anything they say it's been on their lot for the last 6 months! They couldn't fix a row boat

name: Sydney Chamberlain
text:
The people here were very upfront about the condition of the boat, and the customer service was OK. That being said, I have never seen rentals in this bad of condition before. The radio did not work, their was no anchor, the console was missing a cup holder and people had filled the whole console with garbage that was never cleaned up. The boat listed to the right, and the motor took two hours of use before we could get it up to knee boarding speed. Every single seat was torn up, there was mold on the carpet, the boat had sharp metal where the deck had been damaged that could easily puncture a tube you were pulling.

We had fun on the lake with the boat, but it looked like a scow getting us where we were going. The price was a little on the high end for the area, which made the condition of the boat that much more disappointing.

name: Tracy Ellis
text: Had a great experience recently buying a waverunner from John. Competitive pricing, all details just as we discussed when I arrived. Thanks!

name: charlie justice
text: Brought my 20 year old deep v bass boat in for service and repairs.  It would not idle and the power trim had died., also wanted routine service, change oil in foot , tune up, etc.  When I got it back the first time it wasn't quite right, it was hard to start and the power trim only worked for the first half of the fishing trip.  Took it back and they found a broken wire on the power trim and they re adjusted the rebuilt carbs they installed the first time so it starts easy and iidles great. I cant help but be satisfied even though it did take 2 trips to get it right.  And because I had to bring it back they fixed an electric issue I didn't know I had for free.  Every repair doesn't always go perfect and I appreciate how they stood behind their work and made it right.

name: Kurt Finley
text: I’ve been looking for a certain style tritoon boat for awhile. Seen a used one on FB Marketplace. Inquired about the boat through marketplace and started texting John Barkley. Being 3 hours away we discussed the condition of the boat and finally negotiated the price online. I asked John if he would make sure that the trailer wheel bearing had plenty of grease in them being we had a 3 hour trip back. He suggested that I buy a new trailer and offered me one at an unbelievable price! The next day my wife and I drive down to BoatMart and met John. John was very very polite. He demo the boat on the water and answered all my questions thoroughly. He replaced the missing table with a new one! My experience with John was very enjoyable and comfortable. I highly recommend BoatMart of Guntersville Al., and John for all of your boating needs. And yes, I would definitely buy another boat from them!!

name: Carol Smyser
text: Salesman John Barkley was great to work with! He helped me order everything I wanted on my Bennington Pontoon Boat.  GBM has great prices instead of a fancy showroom. I'm enjoying my boat instead of their  showroom!

name: Nic
text: Great customer service!!! I have rented boats from Boat Mart and if i have ever had a problem, they have been stead fast in solving it. Highly recommend the Boat Mart!!

name: Courtney Couch
text:
Would NOT recommend renting from this business. I’m giving it two stars instead of one because, unlike many other commenters, at least our boat ran.
We were promised a Bayliner deck boat when we paid our deposit. However when we arrived they told us there wasn’t one available and said they would have to give us something else that they assured us was “way better.”
The boat was a huge aluminum (which made for a pretty rough ride even at low speeds) deck boat that looked to be at least 15 years old. They claimed the motor was recently replaced but the scratches on it suggested otherwise. I don’t know why (age maybe), but the boat was EXTREMELY difficult to steer. In the few minutes that I drive to give my husband a break, I got a real tricep workout.
The badly stained carpet was littered with food and trash (a bottle cap, Cheerios, and crumbs) when we received it. I lost count of how many times a bug crawled onto my leg or the seat next to me.
The cushions were coming unattached from the hull, with screws sticking out. There were rips in the upholstery. One Bimini strap was broken so we had to use a rope to tie it down. The fuel gauge didn’t work. When we asked for an anchor they told us we’d have to rent one. (Thankfully we had brought our own.)
Like I said, the boat ran. The issues we had did not spoil our fun. But for the $400 we paid I expected to be given something better than this boat that I would have been embarrassed to even offer to a customer.

name: Philippe Cyr
text: John helped me buy a xpress bass boat, and was straight up with me. Would buy from again.

name: Sheri Thornton
text: We rented two jet skis. The first one broke down within 30 minutes and the second was almost out of gas when we got it. We barely made it back. It took the people about 40 minutes to get us a replacement. Then, they wanted to charge us to fill up the empty one with gas......even though we got it empty. They were very rude about it.  The one that they switched the broken one out for was an even older jet ski that wouldn't turn. We just took them both back with an hour and a half left. They didn't offer to make it right in any way. They didn't even seem to care. Other business people around that we talked to didn't seem surprised with our story. I'm surprised these people can stay in business. No customer service and broken down equipment!!

name: Salvatore Carollo
text: Slippery to deal with.. They tried selling me , what they represented as a 2016 boat , when it was a 2014. Mistakes happen I get it , but they were very well rehearsed in their actions which leads me to believe it's a common practice.

name: Kyle Chance
text: Awesome experience!!!  John and Lisa was awesome to work with and recommend everyone to talk to John.

name: Matthew Pylant
text: Great place to get your boat worked on. They also offer parts and rentals.

name: Lee Tucker
text: Great to deal with on our new pontoon boat..we've keep going back and are loyal customers

name: Ernest Moore
text: We did a little work for Eric and he not only paid but gave us very good deal on a boat with the help of john thank you guys ( FROM The Guy's at Fine.Line.Remodeling. & Construction )

name: Linda Bevel
text:
Brian Jones You received a phone call 2 days prior to the day of the rental and agreed to the brand new boat or a refund of your reservation deposit. This did not happen when you showed up.  You didn't even rent the boat. Your father in law did and he apologized for your behavior at the end of the day. The staff you are speaking of were 2 women that you were bullying, and are continuing to bully online. Your father in law was very nice and cordial, and happy with his experience. We rent 17 boats a day and I wish that all the people that are happy with their experience would leave us reviews. Unfortunately it doesn't work that way and Google should be ashamed that they allow reviews on businesses without finding out more information about the situation from the business.

Frances LaPlant, We have dock workers that are responsible for all equipment associated with the rentals. That is why you were told to ask the dock worker for bumpers. Also you were told to call us if you had any problems or issues with the boat. You kept the boat for 2 full days and over night. You never called us and verbally attacked us when returning the boat, after 2 days. No one knew what to say because we were unaware you had any problems. We cannot issue refunds to ANYONE that keeps a boat for the entire rental period and doesn' report a problem.

name: Sean Suttles
text: The first boat broke down about 5 minutes form the Marina, the second boat wasn't a real rental boat as it was described as their 'shop boat'.  To say it was rough was kind but that didn't bother me as it could be expected with a replacement.   However, the battery died on it about 2 hours later.  They said it would be a while before they could get to me, I called a friend who brought me a battery and it started right away after we sat drifting for over an hour.  They ripped me off on gas because I know it wasn't full when I had to refill the 'shop boat' and they got rude when I asked for a discount.  Rent with caution or you risk ruining a day on the lake

name: Anita Field
text: Great experience, the crew and staff were friendly and took great care of us for a family adventure on Lake Guntersville. The deck boat and tube was a blast to rent and everything from the prep to turn-in went very smooth.

name: Ginny Caspar
text: I like the employees that I've met, especially Ms Linda but the marina is pretty sad. It's in dire need of cleaning and repair. The waters around the marina and ramp are full of grass, trash and dead fish! The dock needs rebuilt and there is only one reflector that we've seen on any of the pieces of wood blocking the entrance to the marina from the lake. They need lights, reflectors, reflective paint or something out there.

name: Dayna Masters
text: Recently purchased a 25k +$$ boat from John  the boat had no motors on it , boat mart had taken them off and put on 2 pontoon boats .  We asked if everything on the center console boat was working before they removed motors and was reassured that everything was checked out an everything worked. The boat had a lowrance gps 12” model that costs over 2000$. And I asked him if he had seen it work he said he had and it was working fine. So we purchased boat.  When we paid for the boat,the contract said as is,and and we didn’t get any wtitten guarantees on everything John said worked. After getting new engines we found that the electric anchor could have never worked the switch was missing. Am fm radio was shot 2 way radio was shot. bilge pump didn’t work. salt water pump shot and the gps that was working the previous week had corrosion inside on computer boards totally ruined for quite sometime.  I’m in business for myself and if I lied to my customers like John lied to us I would not be in business for long. Beware of doing business at boat mart their 3.4 out of 5 rating should tell you something

name: Darryl Traylor
text: I wish I could give them a zero star. These are the most rude obnoxious people I have ever talked to. I will drive to Chattanooga before they ever get a cent from me.

name: Jodi Mac
text: We rented a ski boat for the day, though we intended to just tool around the lake. Thank goodness...the steering was so loose we had no precision at all and the boat would not accelerate. In addition, gas fumes were very noxious and none of the gauges worked. We picked the boat up around 11:00 a.m. and though our rental period was over at 5 p.m. we turned the boat in at about 1:30p.m....we had had enough. When we mentioned the issues and that they might want to check this craft out before renting it again, the person behind the desk got very defensive and started getting loud. we were informed that "they rent that boat all the time." I'm sure that is the case, but it doesn't mean that it doesn't need some attention. The craft was the "Hurricane." I would rent from somewhere else next time we are in Guntersville. (Really enjoyed our cabin and the lake is beautiful).

name: meagan collins
text: Tara was the sweetest!!

name: A Payne
text:
My wife and I put a $1,000 deposit on a boat which was listed on ebay after reviewing all the pictures and details provided about the condition of the boat.  We drove almost 2000 miles to get to this dealership.  When we got there John the salesperson showed us the boat.  Wow, seeing the pictures which were carefully managed to avoid things he didn't want us to see we were very very disappointed.  There were large dents in the fencing (pontoon boat) and the picture provided of one spot on interior which was indicated the only interior damage avoided the fact that the helm chair had two large holes in both sides you could put your fist in where arm rests once were.  Sparing the rest of the details of the scene we told John we were not interested and when were were about to ask for our deposit back he said he had options for us.  One was of course new and the other was a 2016 Bennington.  Well, the used Bennington looked so much better than our disappointment we were interested in the Bennington,.  Having never had a Pontoon Boat before and knowing nothing about them really we thought and 2016 model has got to be okay, I mean what can you do in that short time, right?  The boat was not on a trailer at the time we saw it so the deal was he would load it on the trailer and make sure it was ready for our long trip home.  At the first rest stop on the interstate we stopped and I noticed water running out of the pontoons.  It ran and ran and on and on down the incline we were parked on.  I called John and asked him if I had bought a boat with bad pontoons.  John's response was, "It has been in the water for a long time."   I thought, what is that suppose to mean?   It took about 45 minutes for the water to stop after I pulled the plugs out.  We continued on our journey and the next thing that came up was I noticed the hitch was making a lot of noise bouncing around.  I stopped and check to see what was going on and found out that the boat was back about 3 to 4 feet off the trailer.  I grabbed so tie downs I had in the truck and secured it best I could.  I tried moving the boat by hitting the brakes on a hill, nothing.  Because of the stress on the rear axle tires the weight blew one of the tires on the interstate which was fun.  I finally got some help with the boat moving it forward but realized that whomever John had load bout had not checked the bolts on that  hold the stop bunk in position and that they were loose allowing the boat to slide.
When we finally returned home I contacted John and he said " I don't know what you did to it because it was okay when you left here."  I told him that I didn't do anything but that he or someone he had working there had used the trailer for something that required moving the boat stop and neglected to tighten the bolts which caused the problem. His response was I would be happy to extend the warranty on the engine for another 6 months for your trouble.  We also asked not only about if the paper work had been completed on the engine warranty but I also asked about the boat warranty.  I was told that because John was out of town he would have to deal with that, interesting since the lady did everything else.  When John returned he passed the word that our 2016 boat did have a warranty and couldn't have one.  I had been online and found out that all Bennington boats have this incredible warranty which can be passed a long with the selling dealer's assistance.  John passed the word again that because this boat was sold new as a rental it could not have a warranty.  This was never mentioned to us at the critical moment ever or we would have really walked.  I have written several reviews and contacted the BBB and also the Alabama Attorney General's office.  The BBB said the Boat Mart has failed to answer them and they are trying again.  The Alabama Attorney General's office just sent us a letter which included John's response saying he never promised a warranty but he would happy to provide coverage if we take it into their dealership in Alabama 2000 miles away.

name: Nancy Boeding
text: We were vacationing at Lake Guntersville during the last week of March 2018.  My husband and son  were fishing all day every day when Wednesday evening’s fishing was cut short when the motor on our Nitro sarted acting up.   We’ve never had a problem with our boat, and being out of town and unfamiliar with any of the nearby service centers, it was a bit upsetting...not to mention we still had 2 and a half  days of fishing left before we had to go home!   So Thursday morning we called around.  Freedom Marine said they were 2 weeks out and didn’t do emergency repairs, Duckett Marine said they would check to see if the did emergency repairs and call us back...which they did 3 days AFTER we returned home to Ohio!!   But, Guntersville Boat Mart service department knows what customer service.  They talked to us, asked what the motors symptoms were, and invited us to bring the boat to them.   We dropped it off around 11 am and picked it up 2 hours later!   Could not have been more relieved, and happy with their service!   Thank you!

name: Eric McQuiston
text: Terrible place of business.   I have a new 2018 21 ft boat that I purchased a slip($1,600) and trailer storage($200) for the year.    The boat was there about 6-8 weeks total.   To start with,  I called multiple times for a slip so they knew the size make and model of my boat.  After purchasing a slip it was the “wrong one” for my boat on day of arrival.  Luckily there was another slip that “would work.”    This slip broke within a week.  We could not get the boat to come down out of the lift.  The lifts support had somewhat broken and was swaying/leaning putting a bind on the cables.   Had to cancel boating this day after standing around with guests for an hour so they could bring A-frames down another day to lift my boat out of the other lift to get it to another slip for a couple weeks.  Finally my slip was “fixed”.   Looked good at first but after a day out on the water we pulled in and the gears turned but the cables didn’t move.  We called the office and someone came to assess after several minutes.  They hadn’t put a pin through the gear into the pole to which the cable wraps.  We waiting for several more minutes while the guy went to find a bolt to fix the issue meanwhile we watched him go to the gas pumps and kinda “watch over” people using the pump while taking his time getting us situated so we can get the boat up in the lift.   Because let me tell you it’s a job holding the boat still in these slips to keep them from banging the metal deck( they have no rubber bumpers along the deck in slips). He finally got the bolt in and ran off quickly without saying a word even after expressing our appreciation.   Soon we realized something else was up.  The boat lifted but lifted sideways.  After several attempts to get it straight we saw that they never screwed  the poles guide down so when we were lifting the boat the pole walked(rolled) across the back beam causing the problem.  Mind you this lift was “patched” together again as a fix.  They placed a 2x6 across one side to help with the leaning and scabbed the back ibeam where it had broke.   So again I called the office and was told to walk around and find someone to help.  So I found the manager near the dock and let him know what was going on.  He told me that he couldn’t help because they had 5 other things going on right now and that I can’t just come to him at 5 o’clock and get help and that I should just move it to another slip(extra slip made for a wide pontoon boat that had rope pulling the cables closer together to supposedly fit a 21 foot boat).  I told him that we’d had nothing but problems there and I asked if I could get my money back.  He chuckled a little and said there is no way as I signed a contract.   We immediately packed up our storage box along with the boat. It was about a 1.5 hr ordeal that day.  My boat will not be back there. To top it off,   My NEW boat has several bad scratches where the fire hose straps come up the sides of the boat.  These people were rude,  didn’t want to help, and your boat will get damaged here.   So now I’m out $1,800 as they refuse to give a refund.   Do not use this place unless you are a glutton for punishment, you hate your boat, you like playing musical boat slips, and you want to give away your money.

name: Joe Williams
text: We bought a new Bennington Tri-toon from John in September with great off season pricing.  The Yamaha 200hp engine had a lengthy backorder due to production issues so we were unable to actually take delivery until mid November.  This was somewhat annoying as there were still several weekends that were warm.  The owner felt bad about our delay and offered to temporarily mount a 150hp engine that they had on the boat so that we could use it until ours came in.  I declined the offer but I still thought it was an incredible gesture and offer to make us happy buyers.  Took delivery of the boat mid November with no issues.  I have no problems whatsoever recommending Boat Mart to any potential customers.

name: Deedee Smith
text: Great boats, at great prices.

name: Shannon Stephens
text: Renters Beware.  Really bad rental experience on July 4th 2017.  We rented a Bayliner deckboat and was told it would be great for towing a tube.  We had 2 adults & 5 teenage girls on the boat (rated for 14 people) and the boat wouldn’t go 15 miles an hour.  I asked about it when we returned and was told if we didn’t like it, there wasn’t anything they could do about it and that they could have rented the boat to someone else.  Not very customer-friendly.  Too bad, Great location and dock staff was very helpful.  We will be back to Guntersville, but we will rent somewhere else.

name: Linda Hampton
text: Find what I needed and a. bargin on another item....great prices on both . Very pleasant to deal with.

name: Koji Lyu
text: I have purchased boat from here with Extended Service Protection, Guaranteed Refund Agreement.  It was $500 insurance for the outboard motor and at the end of the 5yr, you get refund if you don't use the service.  At the end of the 5yr, I contacted and asked for the refund.  They said mail in the copy and will take care of it.  When I didnt receive the refund, I contact them and they told me that they couldnt read the copy so please send in the original.  So I did.  Still no refund.  I call them again and they said they are on it. months goes by, I call them again and she said I am next for refund??  I continued to call and they no longer answers my call.  I never received a refund on this agreement.  Totally fraud operation.  Buying the boat was a good experience, but this made me never want to do business with this people again.

name: Semper Fi
text:
Took my boat here on a saturday evening after wheel was heating up on passenger side of boat trailer. They called the next thursday and said it was ready to pick up. Now, i was told that they replaced the seal on the drver side of trailer's oil bath hub, not the one that was heating up. Also, when the guy brought it out , both oil bath hubs were completely  full of oil, a big no no. Made it 4 miles back to gas station, same wheel hot as a firecracker. I then limped it up to scottsboro where I bought the boat and had it fixed . Both oil bath hubs had to be rebuilt, new seals, and the wheel was heating due to a stuck /bad hydraulic caliper! I went back to guntersville boat mart and spoke with the service manager where he basically called me a liar, and that they did replace the seal on one hub, and that the hubs were only half full of oil, so they couldnt do anything about the $165 bill they charged me for nothing. DON'T  TRUST THESE PEOPLE WITH YOUR BOAT !!!!!!! I called back to talk with the owner, he wasnt there,but she took my info for him to call back, as I explained to her how dissatisfied  I was, NO call back. I got ripped off here, and I guess thats ok with even the owner of GBM, so no, I would not do bussiness here.
I have the proof on paper showing that nothing had been done to my hubs before getting them rebuilt by another boat mechanic, except that they did fill both hubs slap full of oil, which  that in itself will blow both seal due to the pressure. What a bunch of crooks. If it wouldnt cost me more than what I was charged, I would sue this place, and I'm still thinking about it, and have been advised by an attorney. Maybe if I pursue, it would keep someone else from getting ripped off.

name: Michael St. Peter
text: Rent somewhere else.  We rented a pontoon boat with four grown men to go fishing out of.  It has a 25 HP motor on it and went a staggering 5 miles per hour.   I asked the owner about it and he got angry and said that if we wanted to go "fast" then we should have paid more and rented a bigger boat. The owner was rude and angry at me for confronting him about it.  If the experience was good there, then I would have been back many times with my family and friends to rent boats - but they will never earn my business again. Also, there was no anchor and no ropes to tie off with.  Just terrible experience.

text: Unbelievably unprofessional!  I contacted Tim a week ago and he knew nothing about his listing (a $350k boat). Unknowledgeable about his listing, unreliable delivering on his promise to get me info and unethical to promise information while working another customer to keep me in reserve!!!

text: I've been looking for a center console for 6 weeks - all over the country. I rolled on to the lot and there was the boat I wanted! We reached a deal that afternoon,  had the sea trial the next week and I am the happy owner of a like-new boat. Wade was straightforward and very helpful.

name: Randall Talley
text: I had a great experience purchasing my boat at Orange Beach Boat Sales. Both Tim and Wade we're more than helpful. I saw the listing for the boat I was interested in and sent an email after hours. I received a return call first thing the next day before their listed opening hours. Tim took his time to show me the boat and explain all the details and assist in pricing. With other buyers interested, Tim ensured that I had the time I needed to get my financing in order, make my deposit, and have the engine checked out. Upon finishing the sea trial both Tim and Wade made sure that everything on the boat was set to my liking and had me ready to go. Not too sure why there have been a couple negative reviews, I simply sent an email, received a call back, showed up, treated them with respect, and received nothing but great service. I will be back when it comes time. Thanks guys!!

text: Had a great experience at Orange Beach Boat Sales. Wade was excellent to work with and is very honest. He went above and beyond to make our first boat buying experience amazing. They took the time to go over all of the features of the boat and made sure we were comfortable operating the boat before we left the lot. You can’t go wrong buying a boat from the team at Orange Beach boat sales.

text: Seems many have had a great experience here. Not us. Wife and I are looking over a variety of boat sizes and configurations of used boats to see what fits us. Unfortunately our experience here was not the best. We are passive and easy going. The attitudes and personalities we ran into here were a bit rich at best. We were cash buyers and would have purchased today but were ran off by the brashness of the salesman. Their boats are scatted all over town and you are expected to go find them on your own. We have been to a few boat sales shops from Destin to Gulf shores and I can honestly say do not even bother with this sales group unless you are willing to enter a challenging environment. Attitudes are quite rich and knowledge of inventory is short as well the bulk is not on site. Wish those that choose to shop here nothing but the best of luck and hope we just caught them on an off day.

A Night Mare company - stay away

First he did not know about the boat, then he all of a  sudden he "remembered" , but knew nothing about it, specs or any info, and when i asked why did he not at least call people back when the respond to an add. , he had the guts to say, "i don't know, but maybe i know tomorrow  just call back tomorrow and maybe the boat is sold"
- No,  no please or sorry or any of those words crossed his lips, and actually and basically what he meant was: "  leave me alone, i don't want to be bothered now"- he showed absolute no interest at all.. maybe his commission or profit in that boat was not high enough
That's how they brush their clients off.. Never again. What an arrogant rude bunch of miserable  Incompetents! Just in-case you deal with them or list a boat with them, think twice, you will never sell it !
I own a huge company in Europe  , but such arrogance is mind boggling and totally unacceptable

He’s not pushy, all he wants to do is email me some pictures of a boat he thinks we will like. Long story short it was the same make and model as the one I was trying to work a deal on. Micah was straight forward about price, condition, he listened to what we were looking for in a boat. He was knowledgeable about the boat and the sea trial. So I bought it same boat but with better equipment and better up grades and for a better price.its been a couple of weeks now and Micah still calls just to see how we like the boat and if we have any questions. Still waiting on the other guy to send me the info on the other boat for the loan. name: Mary Lou Bradley
text: I would be very careful when buying a car from here. We bought my daughter a BMW. He and his wife seemed honest people. He spoke of having a strong faith. Shortly after buying the car, the 1st trip on the Interstate, we started having trouble with the car. We have had the car for a year and have replaced many parts on the car & have found out recently that the car is badly flawed. We have completely lost all the money we paid for this car for my daughter. She has cried many tears knowing we have to get her a new car & we don’t have the money, right now to get her a new car. It has been just terribly nauseating and upsetting. My advice is any car you think about buying from here, have a mechanic check it out before buying. Jordan Automotive in Daphne is a great place & he is honest. He doesn’t care if the dealer gets mad. He works for his clients. Doesn’t want his customers to get screwed over like we did.

resp.text: Mary Lou, I am sorry you had a bad experience with the BMW, we had the car checked out before you bought it, and there were no issues, I wish you would have let me know when you first began to have problems. Since we don’t have a crystal ball, we always suggest an extended warranty when buying a high mileage BMW..I am sorry for your trouble with that car, that was not our intent.

name: Jep Hill
text:
Friendly salesman & decent price.

Took my vehicle in for its first oil change to find out it hadn’t been serviced adequately prior to me purchasing. I put 3k miles on the vehicle over 6 months, and found out the oil was so low (no leaks, either) the engine already needed to be flushed. The engine also makes a noise when starting, and I’ve found out the fix is $2,500+.

You may get a good price on a vehicle from Sport Center, but, in my experience, you may not get a reliable, well-maintained vehicle to last the long-haul.

name: A Google User
text: Last week I purchased my third vehicle from Sport Center Imports. When I bought my first vehicle in 2009, I was in my mid-twenties. I had been to several dealership prior to meeting Ben and Gayle Mayfield. To this day, 10 years later I remember the condescending and patronizing interaction from several of our local dealerships.  I was once naive and financially inexperienced. I was intimidated by the large dealerships and the ‘tactics’ they employed. I felt like I was being taken advantage of, looking back, I know I was. I’ve grown up now and I know what I am doing. Still, if Sport Center Imports is in business I won’t purchase from anywhere else. It might sound odd to completely trust a car salesman, but I do.  Every time I leave their lot in my new vehicle I’m amazed at the fairness and transparency with which they operate. I’ve recommended Sport Center Imports to countless family members and friends over the years. I never miss a chance to tell someone about the positive experiences I’ve had with them. They’ve earned my loyalty and if you give them a try, you’ll no doubt feel the same way I do.

We bought a 2015 Chevrolet Tahoe(with around 29,000 miles and some warranty left on it) from them that had been wrecked...twice. Even though this was on the car fax, this information was not disclosed to us. We hear a noise in the rear of the vehicle, so we took it to a local Chevrolet dealership. We were told that the vehicle had been wrecked, not fixed completely, and unsafe for my children and myself to be traveling in. We were advised to contact the dealer first and give them the opportunity to make it right. Sport Center Imports wanted us to bring them the vehicle and let them have another Chevrolet dealer take a look at it. We were given a vehicle to drive and was under the impression that they were going to do everything they could to make it "right". We sought legal advise. We were advised not to accept the vehicle after they had their mechanics look at it, but give them two options... either find us one that was comparable, or buy it back from us. About a week later, one of the owners contacted us to let us know the Tahoe was fixed...it was just a coil spring that needed to be repaired.  Once we explained that we did NOT want this Tahoe, and this was not we had paid all this money for, we were told they would find us one comparable. So once again, we were under the impression they were going to make it right. When they found us another one, it had over 36,000 miles which meant no warranty....BUT we decided to go ahead and purchase it and put it all behind us (after having it looked at by our own mechanics). They agreed to pay the first one off (as a trade-in), and turn around and finance the second one. They did. However,  a couple weeks later, we got a call from the owner letting us know that a payment was late on the first Tahoe (that we traded back in to them BEFORE the first payment was due) and that he didn't want it to damage our credit. We needed to pay it and he would pay the rest of the Tahoe off. Once again, we had to threaten to get a lawyer. We had to contact the credit union to explain what was happening and that we didn't want our credit ruined. It has been a long, drawn out mess! Instead of doing the right thing to begin with, we had to continuously fight with these people to get anything done.  Now they have this very same Tahoe listed on their website.I am warning you...if you do not want a headache, I would look elsewhere. I have since peeled their name off of my vehicle and want no part of anything to do with these people anymore!!!

resp.text: Ms Waite, I am so sorry that we could not offer you a satisfying experience.  Once I found out you were unhappy, I did all that I could do to make it right for you; took the original SUV back, gave you a free loaner car, and purchased a new Tahoe for you.  We post a free Carfax on our website on every vehicle offered for sale, for our customers convenience.  We even discounted the price of the new Tahoe to keep your payments the same, after your credit score dropped almost 80 points, which equaled a loss of $2,800 to us.   Once again, I am sorry that we were not able to exceed your expectations....

text: Great place to buy a vehicle,  Adam was very knowledgeable about the vehicle that we inquired about. We did purchase an auto from them due to the respectful  and polite manner that Adam had.

text: I usually don't write reviews but I decided that with my experience with this place that it would only be fair to give these guys their due credit. I have bought a couple of vehicles from Sports Center Imports over the last few years and I have nothing but good things to say. I tend to do my research for months prior to purchasing and have a really solid idea of pricing and what to look for in a used vehicle purchase. I watch inventory like a hawk at several dealers in a few areas to get an idea of what is available even before I ever go into buy a vehicle in case I have to play a bit of hardball. Well, I have never had to play hardball with these guys, they have never given me even the slightest issue getting vehicle I am looking for at the price range I have in mind. It's never taken me more than an hour or two to get everything taken care of and out the door. They are one of the two (the other closed down due to the owner retiring) used car dealerships that I would be okay with quite literally walking around with a blindfold on, pointing in a random direction, and buying whichever vehicle I pointed at and knowing I wouldn't have an issue.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the Kudo ! Our entire business model has been built on giving customers a positive vehicle buying experience, and EXCEEDING expectation each and every time....Thanks for your business....

resp.text: Vera, I am so sorry to hear, through google,  that you had issues with your truck, I wish you would have called and let us know, we may could have help steer you in the right direction.  Franchise dealership service departments do want to "FIX" anything, only "REPLACE" Everything.  I had that truck inspected at the time it was traded in, and I personally drove it to KY and back and had no issues what so ever.  I wish I had a crystal ball so I could see what the future is in regards to the vehicles we sell, but I do not.  All we can do is try and make them as front line ready to go as possible,  while maintaining the fact that it is a used a vehicle. Once again Vera, I am sorry that you had issues with your truck, and I do wish that you would have notified us sooner.

This was a large purchase and we did not take it lightly, but the Supra quality coupled with Skiers Marine quality and reputation made this new boat purchase an easy decision.

name: Les Webb
text: My family has been buying boats from Skiers Marine for 13 years. Because we spend a lot of time on the water, we have purchased 6 Malibu boats in an effort not to have too many hours on one boat before trading ( it really had nothing to do with all the new cool stuff that became available). We are super excited about Skiers Marine selling MasterCraft boats! We plan on ordering our new MasterCraft boat at the 2016 Birmingham Boat Show. The staff at Skiers Marine treats us like family, and that is very important to my family. This will be our first MasterCraft and we can't wait.

name: Joe Couvillion
text:
My wife and I just purchased a new MasterCraft X-10 from Rett Tyler at Skiers Marine for our family. We couldn't be happier. He knows his stuff and really went above and beyond what I would think anyone should do.  No pressure to buy and he let our 3 little kids climb all over his super nice boats without shedding one tear- while we deliberated over which boat to get.  After several weeks and my slow decision making process -  He drove to pick up the boat - drove to our lake to deliver it and then rode around with us for over 3 hours making sure we were comfortable. I think we had to kick him out of the boat bc we knew that he had an hour and a half drive back home.
Absolutely happy!  And I think their team was just as excited about the boat as we were.

name: Bob Asmar
text:
We recently purchased a 2013 MasterCraft X55 from the Athens, Alabama dealership and it was a wonderful experience.  Kit Barnes was, by far, the best sales person that I have every worked with.  After 20 years of experience with I/Os and a desire to wake surf, we decided to look into purchasing an inboard/tow boat.  Our requirements were unique, in that we wanted a tow boat that was in the 25 foot length, had a large open bow area and yet could also provide a decent wave for surfing.  During my research, it seemed that a Mastercraft X55 was about the only boat that could potentially meet our needs.  I found a few X55’s of interest on Boattrader, sent inquiries out, and Kit was the first to respond (within a day or two).  He later followed up with a phone call to better understand our situation and he even offered advice on different models and brands.  I was very impressed that he expressed interest in helping us find a boat that best matched our needs and really gave me a crash course on the different models of inboards.  The biggest thing is that he really worked with us on the X55, since I knew that we had to stay in a larger model to meet our family’s requirements.  Kit was the only person that was willing to work with us to see if we could configure the X55 to produce a nice wake for surfing.  The test drive went great and with a few adjustments, Kit had the boat configured to make a nice wake for surfing.

We really appreciate the time that Kit spent with us in answering all of our questions and educating us on the Mastercraft X55.  We proceeded to purchase the boat and are also very happy with the ongoing support and service that Skier’s Marine provides to us. The Athens staff made our buying experience great.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and for allowing us to serve you!

name: Advanced Orthodontics
text: Great customer service... they will take care of your boat..

name: kimberly mcleod
text: My family recently purchased a boat from Skiiers Marine (April, 2016). Since we had never owned a boat before, we were very apprehensive and nervous about this process. We met with multiple dealers to get a feel for what we wanted and what we could afford. Skiers Marine provided us first class customer service and was by and far the most knowledgeable and down to earth. The owner, Rhett went above and beyond anything we would ask for in this process. For instance, he brought the boat from Birmingham to our friend's neighborhood on Lake Martin so that we could demo it. He spent a couple of hours with me, my wife, and my three little boys demonstrating the boat. Once we decided that we wanted the boat, the purchase process was straight forward and simple. We live in Northern Atlanta. I expected to take a day off of work to drive to Birmingham and pick up the boat. When the boat was prepared and detailed, Rhett called and let me know the day that HE could deliver it! Rhett drove to Atlanta, delivered the boat, and taught me how to put the boat in and out of the water. Yesterday, I arrived home to a package from Skiiers marine. I opened up the box and found two life jackets! Thank you Rhett and Skiiersmarine for taking care of us through this process. If you are buying a boat for the first time (or 2nd or 3rd time), I would highly recommend Rhett and Skiers marine.

name: Paul Case
text:
After months of searching for our first family boat, I found a used MasterCraft at Skier's Marine.  Living in Minnesota, and not being able to see the boat in person before purchase, Rett was more than accommodating in answering the numerous questions I had before committing to the purchase. He was kind enough to offer to have the boat brought to the Athens store to knock a few hours off of our drive.  The day we picked up the boat, Chad spent a few hours making sure I was familiar with the boat on the water.  2,000 miles and a memorable road trip with my son later, we have the boat back in MN.  Rett and Chad truly care about their customer's experience. I wouldn't  hesitate to drive 2,000 miles again to buy another boat from Skier's Marine in the future. Thank you.

The Case Family
Champlin, MN
