name: James Johnston
text: Seems like they wanted to make more money they would spend $8 an hour on somebody to answer their phonesIs impossible to get in touch with them

resp.text:
Hi James. Sorry to read that you had some difficulty reaching us by phone. :( Although we are not always able to predict just how many phone representatives we should have available, we are increasing our capacity to answer questions via social media (@thmarineteam) and our Help Page with email contact form (linked below), so please feel free to contact us anytime using those channels. If you can't reach us by phone, please visit us at www.thmarine.com/help -- from there, you can access a variety of FAQs, tips, and a contact form where we can get you directly connected with the right member of our team.

Either way, we'll do our best to provide you a personalized, typed reply, but you can also provide a call-back number and a good time to reach you if a phone call would be better. Sorry again for the trouble in getting through amid the other calls, but we hope you'll take advantage of one of our other options to get started with helping you.

name: Ersi Bice
text:
You guys have made if very difficult to earn my business in the future.  I ordered a tube where i can fit my electrical fish rod tools but to my surprise, the product arrives with no end caps.  All while the product picture has end caps, which is basically false advertisement.  So let me get this straight, your customers are coming to your site to buy an empty tube with no end caps?  I can conveniently drive to home depot and get a random pipe for that.  Or even ask my neighbor.  How about putting it in capital letters on your site  that "the tube doesn't come with end caps."  Then it would be up to the customer to read and do the proper product research.

But wait there's more.  So i was already super irritated at the lack of logic being used on this one but i refrained from writing a bad review.  Instead, I brushed it off, went on the website, and found I can just order these vynil end caps for $2, plus shipping.  Whatever! Right?  It happens!

But my disappointment didn't stop there.  I received the package, opened it and only one cap was inside.  Again, the product page is titled "black vynil caps" and the first picture is a picture of multiple caps.  So once again, misleading a returning customer that already gave you a second chance.  Where is the logic?  I am certain that you have run into this problem before.  Why is it not fixed.  You risk reputational damage for a few extra bucks.

I just don't understand how your number one priority isn't to make life easier for your customers and delighting them at every step of the sales process....  I am stuck between throwing the tube out and looking elsewhere, or just ordering another stupid end cap and paying shipping FOR THE THIRD TIME

resp.text: Hi Ersi. We are very sorry to read about this, but we do want to help you and improve what we're doing, too. Can you please send us this message at thmarine.com/writeus or contact us via Facebook Messenger? That will help us to get a better understanding of what we could do better, along with allowing us to ask some questions about this situation. Sorry again for the trouble, but we hope you'll write us so we can do our best to help.

name: Bug Tarleton
text: I had a life threatening experience yesterday with a "hot foot" that had no stop bolt on it.The throttle broke and the motor was wide-open throttle (W.O.T.) at 75 mph and I had to shut it off with the kill switch.I called the company to let them know that the stop was missing and that is what hyper-extended the other manufacturer part. I first told them that I wasn't going to sue them I just wanted them to know to fix the bolt so it couldn't be removed just adjusted.They never would let me explain what actually happened. They just kept saying they didn't make that part. It is SAD that someone will have to get killed to resolve this. I was just trying to save a family some grief. I called my dealer and my new part was on the way in ten minutes.That is how you do it, T AND H MARINE.Your products are great but your success has blinded you.

name: Nathina Greco
text: I see all the reviews are over 2 years ago, please allow me to update you with a current review. I WILL SUPPLY PHOTOS AND AUDIO OF OUR CONVERSATIONS( from when I picked it up) TO PROVE EVERYTHING STATED HERE IS TRUE! I found Trey(the owner) via Facebook, I always do my research. I saw these reviews, and decided to give him a call, it was a week before memorial day weekend. I can provide all call logs, I told him I have an RV that has a lighting issue that I need checked. Considering I am a first time owner he said it may be a simple fix. I said great when may I drop it by? He said he is backed up and it would really help him out a lot if I could bring it by that Tuesday, I told him that sounds great. He asked that I send him my address and the issues via text before hand. I did. I had to work late and had my cousin drop it off. Please see the photos of our texts. I told him a million times DO NOT BUY ANYTHING for the RV I ONLY want a diagnosis. He took a week, and ended up purchasing: -LP for the RV, Checking the outside, HE BROKE the generator and told me that it stopped working. He even said on audio, it was working when you dropped it off. HE broke the battery disconnect again which was working when I dropped it off. When I went to pick it up he kept repeating how he put me in front of other projects and he needs more time. I explained how he told  me to bring it in on that day because he was behind the previous week. He said well ,.... this that...ect Please see the itemized bill of the charges and work he tried to charge me for that I specifically asked him not to do. I have no doubt he is good at working on more commercial projects,but to try and take advantage of  smaller projects is just not good business. I found another company I would recommend to anyone else who is looking for help, If you drive to him he will diagnose for free and walk the entire vehicle with you! It's Deitz Mobile RV. He does have a few different businesses so his response may be slow, but at least he is honest and up front about everything!

name: Charles Michael

text: I have had boats for 40+ years. The service I received exceeded my expectations. There were a total of eight different problems or concerns  with the boat. The staff were very knowledgeable about the boat and the problems I was experiencing. The technician (20+ years experience) explained what and how the repair each of problem would be done. I brought the boat in and picked it up the next day. Based on my prior experience with boat repairs,  I expected to wait one to four weeks. The technician told me in detail what was done which included an overall inspection of the boat. He provided valuable information and advice for care, maintenance, and running the boat. Needless to say, I am totally confident in having all future maintenance and repairs done by this shop.

name: John Doss
text:
Took my boat/ motor in for repairs wasn’t running right. Had been running strong. They thoroughly checked it out. Wasn’t cheap. They showed me the compression and said it wasn’t worth repairing. Wanted to sell me a new motor. That didn’t sound right 330 hrs on the Yamaha 250 2stroke and was strong as heck before. Went on the hull truth blog site put the question out about the compression and what this shop said. The general reply was to run away from that shop was nothing wrong with the compression. They (hull truth) gave great detail how the lower pistons come built with different compression and reasons. I asked mechanic at gulf coast and he got defensive about what I read on hull truth.  Took it to colonial outboard repair in daphne, they fixed! it same motor, running great. I waited months to post review to be sure motor didn’t fail after all. Be very cautious you can see the post on hull truth under Yamaha 250 ox66 compression issue.
Update: second season, motor still running strong 5000 rpm 45mph on a 25’ boat.

text: Third time using them for service on my boat but I will not return. Took my boat in for basic service, oil change,coolant flush, change impeller, service lower unit, check fluids and trailer. After 30 days of the boat being there they left a message and said the boat was ready. I called right back and said I was on my way. When I called back I was then informed that they didn't change the impeller and it would be 8-10 hours at $95 a hour plus parts to change the impeller. Seemed high so I called another place and was quoted 2.5 hours of labor plus parts. Called Trotter back and their answer was that I should probably take it there cause they must be more familiar with servicing them. It would have been nice to know that 30 days ago that trotter marine is not familiar with servicing my type boat. They serviced the boat last year for a reasonable price and I had no issues, so I felt I would be taken care of this year with similar customer service and price. Turns out they have a different mechanic then they had last year. I Felt like the bill was a little high compared to the previous year but did not bring it up when I was there because I couldn't remember exactly what I paid before and I had to be at work. When I got home I found my bill from last year, I was charged $500 more this year for the same type service. The only thing they did different this year was coolant flush and service the lower unit. I Feel like I was overcharged.  I have a mercruiser 496 I/o motor.  I would take your boat somewhere else.

name: Ryan Church
text:
Stephanie Gallagher is a fantastic Salesperson who stayed late to answer all our questions before we made our purchase. Even after we made a purchase she has continued to check with my wife via phone calls and texts to make sure we are still happy and the family is enjoying the Viking VI. I would highly recommend her as a sales person and as a generally very nice individual who has gone above and beyond to build and keep a relationship. I would recommend her and her team to get you into a quality ATV and to answer your questions thoroughly before you make a purchase.
Oh, and the builder at Speedzone thought that he might have missed tightening a bolt, so Stephanie called and asked if he could immediately come out to our house and check it. He came out, checked the bolt and got it all taken care of. Very professional and responsive. Very courteous and showed that they care about their customers. Will definitely do business with them again.

text: Absolutely great service and friendly help! Stephanie Swafford was excellent help when making my purchase.  I pretty much bombarded her with questions via txt on a particular ATV to help me confirm all the features before I made the hour drive. Would totally give SpeedZone my business again.

name: Zane Cardwell
text: The level of customer service at this Speed Zone location is the by far the pinnacle of what customer service should be. The sales team was incredible especially my salesperson Jayla. Living two hours away was rather daunting when taking into consideration not only the logistics of getting the 2020 YZF-R6 I searched so hard for, but also just how overwhelming it felt being my first brand new bike to purchase from a dealership, however Jayla was there the entire time and through every step of the way. At no point did I ever feel lost through the process. If premier quality of customer service is important to you then look no further Speed Zone of Oxford is the place you want to be and Jayla is the sales person you want to have.

name: Hayden Lee
text:
Back in November(2020) I bought a bike from a private party. I brought it here to have some preventive maintenance done plus a couple of extra things. Tyrone listened to what I was wanting done and never tried to over sell me. Any questions I had he answered and if he didn't know he found someone who did.

The tech, Marcelo, does great work and is quick. In less than a week he had my bike running like a brand new one. I've put a few hundred miles on it since I got it back from their service department and I will confidently use them again.

resp.text: Thank you so very much. We appreciate you.

text: I had a positive purchase experience.  Chris and I communicated frequently via text which made getting updates easy.  The building was clean, I observed positive staff/buyer interactions.   My experience with the finance representative was also positive.   Nothing was pushed on me to additionally purchase and the casual conversation was enjoyable.

name: More Than More
text: Worked with Stephanie Gallagher here to purchase a few dirtbikes for my kids, she was absolutely fantastic.  She was able to give me all the information I needed over the phone which was important due to my schedule, and we were able to handle most of the transaction before I traveled to the store to pick up the bikes.  While there she was extremely helpful with answering questions and helping me with establishing the financing through Honda, and Jeremiah over in parts was awesome with the kids.  He was able to get all 3 set up with helmets/goggles/ boots while I was working on the paperwork, and they all loved their new gear.  So overall, great shop and great folks, highly recommend.

text:

Sales guy tried his best to make it work but they have a horrible management issues msrp on the machine is 12,399 got an out the door price of over 18,000 and come to find out they wanted to add a 5 year factory warranty and service plan told them I wasn’t interested in any extra add ons as such and was told they would remove them then came back with a price of over 16,000 now trying to include a 7 year warranty instead of a 5 year told them I DID NOT WANT the extended warranty and was told that they have people lined up to buy the machines with the extended warranty and they wouldn’t sell it to me without including it! This is not a dealership this is a STEALERSHIP!!!!
BEWARE ANYONE LOOKING TO PURCHASE ANYTHING FROM THEM AFTER THIS I WOULDNT BUY A 10 DOLLAR BICYCLE FROM THEM. THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE

Blake,
I know you talked with one of our operations managers today. Was anything resolved? I see via the correspondence between you and the sales person there seems to be some miscommunication with what was said and what you posted here.

name: Mike Fisher
text: This dealer is taking advantage of customers during a time when production has been slow due to the pandemic. They misrepresented several things to us. We were told they have to pay Honda MSRP so their only way to make any money was to charge us a $1600 freight and bolt charge. That is simply not true. They also tried to sell us a maintenance plan saying the first maintenance required on the machine we were considering would cost $500. We discovered this maintenance was simply changing the oil and spark plugs which can easily be done by me for a material cost of $65. We had a UTV we took to get a possible trade in value on and after having their service department look at it came out with a long list of work it needed and offered us a RIDICULOUSLY low offer of $1850. We took that machine to a mechanic later and it required a tune up that cost me $150 and I sold it for $6000. Not only are they gouging people on pricing they are being dishonest while doing it.  Needless to say we did not buy anything here. Won’t go back and won’t recommend. Bought the machine they quoted us for $3000 less at a dealer in Mississippi. Well worth the drive to get it. Shop around. Call them. Honda of Laurel. Great honest folks.

name: Eric Larson
text:
I would be careful relying on the reviews by folks with 1 or 2 total reviews and no profile ect. More than likely fake accounts made to influence the rating on Google.  Look though the reviews of those with real accounts.

We had mixed experiences. It seems it depends on the mood of the sales folks if they want to be fair or try to score on a huge markup on a sale.

You will find “internet” pricing on many of their products and that price seems fair compared to other shops. The problem is when they give you the “out the door” price you will see they jack up the “fees” to more than make up for that good price.

They matched another dealer on our first purchase.    When I wanted to buy a second machine they quoted almost $7,000 out the door on a $4,697 internet priced motorcycle with original msrp $5,299.   $1,700  in “fees” plus taxes.

Just be aware of the hard sale tactics and watch the dealer fees.  They also want you to buy the massive markup warrantee and finance at 15-25%.  They actually don’t seem to want cash sales.

Needless to say I drove over to Atlanta and I’ve found several dealerships much easier to deal with. We bought the same bike for way under $6,000 out the door. The crazy part is I actually ended up buying 2 bikes at the dealer in Atlanta!   My son got a new R3 and Wife got a Ninja 400.

A few hours later the price was increased to the standard $6999 price everyone is asking for that bike. One month later I checked back and the price is again listed for $6089! This is clearly bait and switch tactics!

As it turns out, we decided to switch the unit for the depot and bring the problem unit back to Tx.  THE POINT IS  TYRON IN SERVICE IS WONDERFUL< AWESOME<AND OFFERED TO HELP ME IF NEEDED!! text:
Hands down worst customer service in my life. The prices are outrageous and the staff do not care about the customer. I asked for a help with a flat tire (kids 50cc bike) and they quoted me at $100.00 for repairing it. I told the guy it could just need air and might not need anything else, but he didn’t seem to want to air it up for me real quick to check. I then ask for a price on checking out an ATV (kids 50cc) and making sure the governor is working properly. He stated that would be $100.00 just to look at it. I told him I would put both bikes in for a full tune up service if the price was good. He stated he could do $150.00 tune up for the ATV but still would charge me an addition $100.00 to look at the governor issue. I told him that all he had to do is turn the bike on and hit the gas (in order to see if it has a governor issue). He said that is not included in the tune up (apparently they don’t start and run bikes they do tune ups on...🤷🏽‍♂️) so I would pay a total of $250.00 for just the ATV.

I have been riding bikes and visiting motorcycle shops for 25 years. Worst experience ever.

name: Christina Malone
text:
DO NOT TRUST THESE PEOPLE! THEY WILL SAY ANYTHING TYou O MAKE A SALE! THEY WILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF AN INEXPERIENCED CONSUMER!

My 20 year old son purchased a Rancher with accessories including snorkel kit with Bama Power Sports. The salesman asked the service manager if installing the snorkel kit would void the warranty, the service manager said he didn't know but not to worry about it. They would fix it if it messed up. So, it was not disclosed to him that by using the accessories he purchased it could potentially void his warranty. He was however told by the salesman, in front of two witnesses, that Bama Power Sports would warranty it for 1 year "It doesn't matter if you set it on fire or run it into a lake, we will cover it".  THEY SAID WHATEVER THEY THOUGHT HE WANTED TO HEAR TO MAKE THE PURCHASE.

The first time my son took his Rancher out he used the snorkel kit. It got water in it. He looked under the 4-wheeler and there was a hose unattached. Had to be a poor install since it was the first time my son took it out. Honda Warranty will not cover it, snorkel kit, makes sense. But now Bama Power Sports is denying the salesman ever said anything about a 1 year warrant to these kids. Now I know these kids do not know anything warranties so they did not make this statement up. Bama Power Sports allowed my son to leave there thinking he was completely covered and is now refusing to make things right. $1,800 repair.

We tried to negotiate some sort of deal with them to take partial responsibility but they refused to speak to our attorney or have their attorney speak to ours. We decided we didn't trust these people enough to even work on it. When we went to pick it up they brought it out in pieces on pallets. I just hope all the parts are there. We now have to take it to someone else to fix it. Expensive way for my son to learn some places are dishonest and get everything in writing.

name: brandon cook
text: (EVERY ONE MUST READ )DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH SPEEDZONE OF OXFORD.  They advertised a sxs for one price but wrote it up for more than they advertised.not talking about the add on like extended warranty or prep fees.im talking the price on the tag for the unit. Save your self some time and money go to Motorcycle sports or Talladega cycle. Speedzone is already over priced. They sold my wife a used rzr for 2500 more than what it would cost new and it was bone stock.(extra b.s) so after taking our Polaris to have serviced thru there speed pass.this is ruffy 1 year later cause hey I paid for why not use it. Well let's start off by saying this is the 3rd time the ploaris has been in for service.so dropped it off on a Tuesday and they tell me it will be ready on the next day. So the next day rolls around and I do not get a call to come pick it up. So the next day Thursday I call them and ask if it's ready to be picked up. They informed me yes it is ready. So let's load the trailer and go to pick it up.once getting there they hand me paper work and he goes to find my sxs. He is walking around everywhere in the shop to find this sxs. So I look at the paperwork and it is paperwork for a Honda i used to own not the Polaris so I tell him it's the ploaris not the Honda due to the Honda being in Texas now. They then go on to tell me that they just completeld the work on my Honda.so that's when I decided to let him know that it's in Texas. But yet they did the service and paperwork.once we found our ploaris we were told it would be ready the next day. So moving on to next day we get there to pick up the machine thsy has 150 hrs on it and they only do a 25 hr service on the machine. They cant tell me how many services it has had even tho they did it. So there goes our warranty  and extended warranty. Man this place is the biggest joke ever. For anyone to buy from them and give a good review. They must be standing by your side telling you what to write before you leave there store.

text: FYI. Speed zone motor sports does not do service work on anything over 10 years old. I called about having the electronic shift looked at on my rancher 350. The lady said we are backed up so it will be a couple weeks before I can get to it. I told her that would be fine I wasn’t in a hurry that I just needed it before hunting season. She said bring it down. So I spent 20-30 minutes hooking up the trailer and loading the 4-wheeler and 45 minutes driving down there. Just to find out they will not work on my 2005 rancher. Let me be clear, I’m not upset that they wouldn’t service my atv. I’m upset that about 3 hours of my Saturday had been wasted and could’ve been avoided by simply telling me their policy over the phone. And the fact that the lady acted as though I had wasted her time. When in actually I feel as though my time was wasted. I’ve bought several parts and dealt with Bama Power sports service dept before this interaction with no problems whatsoever. Not to mention Bama Power Sports seemed to be thankful for my business. I’ve never left feeling as though I wasted their time. I was concerned when I saw management was changing but with all the good reviews I figured it would be the same experience as before. name: Blaine Hurt
text: I went in a little while back just looking for a mask for cold weather riding.  I walked in and didn't see anyone nor was I approached.  That's not a big deal, but after not finding what I was looking for I started looking for an employee.  I heard people laughing in the back and found all the employees laughing and carrying on.  I stepped in and asked about the mask, after they all went silent as if I had interrupted their important meeting, one guy turned and pointed me in a direction instead of showing me where they were.  I just walked out the door.  I realize it was a small item, but that was incredibly poor customer service.  I did not feel welcome.

name: Kane Pitts
text: Awesome experience with Speedzone Motorsports! Go see Leslie in Service.

name: TJ
text: Stopped in at Sppedzone and asked about a sxs that has a MSRP of about $17,000.00 and the salesman said that's about $20,000.00 out the door. But, on Speedzones website it was $15,540.00 and I brought that to his attention and then he said it will be about $18,000.00  out the door. I said why didn't you say that when I asked and he said you have to tell us the internet price to get it for that. I said that is ridiculous. I will be going somewhere else. He called me a little while later and said I could get it for $15,640.00 out the door. I ended up going to Auburn to buy it because I feel Speedzone is a RIP off. The place in Auburn was straight forward when I called and asked the price out the door.  Speedzone  also quoted me a windshield for $512.00, that on Hondas website has a MSRP of $479.00. So be aware and know how much stuff is before you go here.

name: brandon cook
text: (EVERY ONE MUST READ )DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH SPEEDZONE OF OXFORD.  They advertised a sxs for one price but wrote it up for more than they advertised.not talking about the add on like extended warranty or prep fees.im talking the price on the tag for the unit. Save your self some time and money go to Motorcycle sports or Talladega cycle. Speedzone is already over priced. They sold my wife a used rzr for 2500 more than what it would cost new and it was bone stock.(extra b.s) so after taking our Polaris to have serviced thru there speed pass.this is ruffy 1 year later cause hey I paid for why not use it. Well let's start off by saying this is the 3rd time the ploaris has been in for service.so dropped it off on a Tuesday and they tell me it will be ready on the next day. So the next day rolls around and I do not get a call to come pick it up. So the next day Thursday I call them and ask if it's ready to be picked up. They informed me yes it is ready. So let's load the trailer and go to pick it up.once getting there they hand me paper work and he goes to find my sxs. He is walking around everywhere in the shop to find this sxs. So I look at the paperwork and it is paperwork for a Honda i used to own not the Polaris so I tell him it's the ploaris not the Honda due to the Honda being in Texas now. They then go on to tell me that they just completeld the work on my Honda.so that's when I decided to let him know that it's in Texas. But yet they did the service and paperwork.once we found our ploaris we were told it would be ready the next day. So moving on to next day we get there to pick up the machine thsy has 150 hrs on it and they only do a 25 hr service on the machine. They cant tell me how many services it has had even tho they did it. So there goes our warranty  and extended warranty. Man this place is the biggest joke ever. For anyone to buy from them and give a good review. They must be standing by your side telling you what to write before you leave there store.

name: Andrew Zinn
text: I want to thank Jennifer and all the staff at SpeedZi\one once again.  I was very pleased with my Honda PCX 150, but felt like it was time to upgrade to a larger, more powerful ride.  I liked the Honda DCT series of bikes.  I was keen  on the idea of having manual AND automatic transmissions on the same bike.  I felt this would be a logical transition from moped to a cruiser style bike.  Jennifer and the helpful financing department were able to help me trade in my moped and put me on a brand new Honda CTX 700.  I got on the bike and got used to it.  I rode and rode and had to make myself go home because I was having such a hell of a time riding.  If you're looking to make a change in what you're riding, or want to start riding period, I strongly recommend you visit Jennifer in sales and the other friendly and helpful staff at SpeedZone of Oxford.

name: Robert Johnson
text: I recently went in for service to my 2002 Sv650s. It was back firing,i was told it was running to lean and a jet kit needed to be installed since i had a yoshi exhaust. Long story short, they had my bike for exactly a month charged me almost 500 dollars for everything and on the ride home i had the same problem. Still popping and hiccups. Throttle response was great an more power but that's not why i brought it there. So i went home looked at the carbs and the funnel of the carb was cracked. Its suppose to be new parts. Took it back the next morning told him everything an showed him the crack his response "how did you see that". My opinion, if you have a real issue with your bike take it somewhere else, but if you need tires or something small, by all means go ahead. Once they fix this ill never go back for anything other than riding gear or the snack machine. I wish i would have taken the 2.6 review on Google more serious.

text: I bought a used Bass Cat bass boat from these guys, sight unseen. Then drove all the way down from Wisconsin to pick it up. The boat was everything they said it was and more! Phil and his team couldn't have been more pleasant to work with. They took me out for a test drive and very patiently explained all the bells and whistles on this boat. Then because we were talking so long their mechanic found an issue with the water pump that no one had spotted before. I thought it was working fine but it wasn't up to their standards. They completely rebuilt the water pump for me before they would send it out the door. They were great to work with from start to finish, I love the boat, and don't regret the 900 mile drive to pick it up! The only issue I have is I wish they were closer to me so I could take all my work to them!

name: junk can
text: Having been involved in recreational boating or commercial shipping nearly my whole life of almost 50 years, I can eagerly attest that Nelson Boatyard is a bright spot in the South for commercial and recreational boaters to service their vessels!  The very affordable rates make the location a win to begin with.  The massive capacity of this large and expanding boatyard is another positive, though they graciously made room for me even in the midst of the fallout of Hurricane Sally .  However, perhaps the best aspect of the facility are the brilliant array of professionals associated with it who are able to attend to any matter that one might face.  Though I intended to perform all the work on my boat, I was delighted to find both excellent, generous guidance and reliable, experienced service providers to attend to all my needs that were beyond my own capacity.  I suppose that is to be expected from a business operated by four generations of one family!   I will be gladly returning from Pensacola for routine maintenance every two years!
